abstract: There are more than 110 million instances of impaired driving each year in the United States, and 11,000 deaths, despite 30 years of drunk driving advocacy.
snippet: There are more than 110 million instances of impaired driving each year in the United States, and 11,000 deaths, despite 30 years of drunk driving advocacy.
lead_paragraph: On Sept. 15, Matthew Grape, 21, got into the passenger seat of a car with one of his Duke University fraternity brothers. The driver hit a tree, escaping with minor injuries, but killing his dear friend. According to local press reports, the driver was charged with impaired driving.

headline.main: Friends Still Let Friends Drive Drunk
